result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Flores was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days; alternate 5 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Flores

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia in court.   Defendant Jose Flores did not appear, appearance waived.   Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Ct. 1 to retail theft contrary to section 13.102(c)(12)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Fine totaling $236.00 to be paid within 90 days; alternate 5 days jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jose Flores in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Garcia requests the interpreter's appearance waived.  Charges to be amended to a citation with upfront payment of restitution.  Defendant's and interpreter's appearance waived at August 24, 2015 hearing if charges are amended.  Attorney to advise Court if an interpreter is needed for August 24, 2015 hearing. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jose Flores in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. There has been an offer if defendant pays upfront restitution per the DA's office. Court will give a date in 30 days. Patrick given date and time for next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Jose Flores in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.
  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
